conclusion: To determine the initial distance between the two cars when they avoid colliding, analyze velocities and positions at the intersection point.
Intersection represents time t = 20 seconds, the last moment before collision if not for the space between cars.
Determine velocities and accelerations of each car.
Car A starts at v_A(0) = 25 m/s and decelerates to zero by t = 30 s.
Car B starts at v_B(0) = 15 m/s and decelerates to zero by t = 30 s.
Calculate acceleration a_A for Car A: a_A = -5/6 m/s².
Calculate acceleration a_B for Car B: a_B = -1/2 m/s².
Calculate the position of each car as a function of time.
Position function for Car A: x_A(t) = x_A(0) + [25t - 5/12 t²].
Calculate x_A(20) for Car A: x_A(20) = x_A(0) + 333.33.
Position function for Car B: x_B(t) = x_B(0) + [15t - 1/4 t²].
